isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 5000 9100 9200 9400 9900 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - 5000, 5000i, 9000, 9000i - OPERATION - ENGINE OIL PRESSURE GAUGE, LIGHT, AND ALARM

svcproc.title: ENGINE OIL PRESSURE GAUGE, LIGHT, AND ALARM

svcprocinfo.para: The input signal to the Speedometer/Tachometer module for the engine oil pressure gauge (and warning light and alarm) comes from a gauge sender with mechanical engines or the ECM with electronic engines.

svcsubproc.title: Electronic Engines
svcsubproc.para: The International, Caterpillar, Cummins and Detroit Diesel electronic control systems include a sensor to determine engine oil pressure, so the information is in the ECM.

The ECM sends a signal in the form of a serial data transmission over the ATA data link circuit (a positive and negative pair of twisted wires) to the Speedometer/Tachometer module through connector (421). The signal is also present at the ATA data link connector and oil pressure can be read using an electronic service tool (EST).
For additional information on the data link refer to GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL, Electronic Engine Controls, in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

svcsubproc.title: Mechanical Engines
svcsubproc.para: With mechanical engines, a 3-wire oil pressure sender (565) is installed on the engine. Circuit 35A supplies 4.4 volts from the Speedometer/Tachometer module to the sender at the red wire. The sender is grounded from the black wire on circuit 35-G to the Speedometer/Tachometer module. The sender returns a variable signal (0.5 volt minimum) to the Speedometer/Tachometer module on circuit 35.

svcsubproc.title: Oil Pressure Gauge
svcsubproc.para: The Speedometer/Tachometer module processes the signal from the sender and outputs signals to drive the gauge through connector (422) on circuits 35S(+), 35S(-), 35C(+) and 35C(-) to the left gauge cluster at connector (424). The oil pressure gauge is a 4-pin electronically driven gauge that plugs into the gauge cluster.

svcsubproc.title: Warning Light
svcsubproc.para: The oil pressure warning light should turn ON and remain on as a bulb test, while the gauges go through the self test process with key ON and engine OFF.

The low oil pressure warning light in the left gauge cluster receives ignition voltage (key ON) through cluster connector (423) from 10A fuse F4-A. The warning light ground path is through cluster connector (423) on circuit 35L to the Speedometer/Tachometer module connector (422). In response to sensor or ECM inputs indicating low oil pressure, the module opens and closes a ground switch causing the light to turn ON or OFF.

svcsubproc.title: Alarm
svcsubproc.para: In response to sensor or ECM inputs indicating low oil pressure, the Speedometer/Tachometer module causes the alarm to sound. The alarm will sound five short beeps when the low oil light turns ON. The alarm is an internal feature of the Speedometer/Tachometer module.

svcsubproc.title: Alarm And Warning Light Trip Points
svcsubproc.para: The Speedometer/Tachometer module reports low oil pressure (alarm and warning light) differently with electronic engines than with mechanical engines. With the electronic engines, the low oil pressure signal comes from the engine ECM over the data link. The low oil pressure alarm and warning lights are turned ON and OFF by diagnostic messages provided by the International, Caterpillar, Cummins or Detroit Diesel ECM (engine controller).
With mechanical engines and standard sensors, the trip point for the low oil pressure alarm and warning light is programmed in the Speedometer/Tachometer module by International.
